newsitem.title: SPAIN: SOCCER SHOWCASE-RAUL LEADS REAL TO 4-1 WIN IN MADRID DERBY.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER SHOWCASE-RAUL LEADS REAL TO 4-1 WIN IN MADRID DERBY.

text.p: Real Madrid took a giant leap
towards taking the Spanish league title when teenage striker
Raul Gonzalez led them to a 4-1 victory over neighbours Atletico
Raul saved the blushes of teammate Predrag Mijatovic, who
missed several chances and was sent off for insulting a linesman
in his debut Madrid derby. The result leaves Real six points
clear of second-placed Barcelona, who face Real Betis on Sunday.
Kiko Narvaez had put Atletico ahead against the run of play
in the 32nd minute, and Radomir Antic's side had chances to
But Raul equalised right after the break and then put his
side ahead eight minutes from time with a superb solo goal.
With Atletico pushing forward, Clarence Seedorf pounced on a
mistake at the back for Real's third and midfielder Victor
Sanchez rifled home the fourth on the stroke of full time.
